1: <sup>1</sup> I will bless the LORD at all times: his praise shall continually be in my mouth.
2: <sup>2</sup> My soul shall make her boast in the LORD: the humble shall hear thereof, and be glad.
3: <sup>3</sup> O magnify the LORD with me, and let us exalt his name together.
4: <sup>4</sup> I sought the LORD, and he heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.
5: <sup>5</sup> They looked unto him, and were lightened: and their faces were not ashamed.
6: <sup>6</sup> This poor man cried, and the LORD heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.
7: <sup>7</sup> The angel of the LORD encampeth round about them that fear him, and delivereth them.
8: <sup>8</sup> O taste and see that the LORD is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.
9: <sup>9</sup> O fear the LORD, ye his saints: for there is no want to them that fear him.
10: <sup>10</sup> The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger: but they that seek the LORD shall not want any good thing.
11: <sup>11</sup> Come, ye children, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear of the LORD.
12: <sup>12</sup> What man is he that desireth life, and loveth many days, that he may see good?
13: <sup>13</sup> Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.
14: <sup>14</sup> Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.
15: <sup>15</sup> The eyes of the LORD are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.
16: <sup>16</sup> The face of the LORD is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
17: <sup>17</sup> The righteous cry, and the LORD heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.
18: <sup>18</sup> The LORD is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and saveth such as be of a contrite spirit.
19: <sup>19</sup> Many are the afflictions of the righteous: but the LORD delivereth him out of them all.
20: <sup>20</sup> He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.
21: <sup>21</sup> Evil shall slay the wicked: and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.
22: <sup>22</sup> The LORD redeemeth the soul of his servants: and none of them that trust in him shall be desolate.
